subject: p12810135
History: Status post CABG with chest tube removal. Comparison to prior study dated at 17:34. Portable AP upright chest film, at 15:15 is submitted.
Impression: Interval extubation, removal of the nasogastric tube, removal of mediastinal drains and removal of left basilar chest tube. Right internal jugular central line has its tip in the distal superior vena cava, unchanged. Persistent low lung volumes with patchy bibasilar opacities and a probable layering left effusion. These findings likely reflect compressive atelectasis. No pneumothorax is seen. Status post median sternotomy with stable postoperative cardiac and mediastinal contours.
